item.title: Seizing Maduro? Quick. Fixing Venezuela’s oil production? Years.
item.description: A nation wrecked by Chávez’s and Maduro’s socialist mismanagement has a long recovery road ahead.

item.title: Trump goes monster-hunting, untainted by a whiff of legality
item.description: Colin Powell’s “Pottery Barn rule” comes to mind after U.S.’s seizing of Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Trump claims the U.S. will ‘run’ Venezuela. What’s the plan?
item.description: The raid to nab Maduro was brilliantly executed. The aftermath could get extremely messy.

item.title: Justice in Venezuela
item.description: The next challenge is setting the country up for long-term success.

item.title: The 20 best things Trump did in 2025
item.description: The accomplishments of a stunning year can’t be captured in just 10 items.

item.title: ‘This is not regime change’: María Corina Machado’s message to Americans
item.description: The Nobel Peace Prize winner discusses her Freedom Manifesto and whether Venezuela can move beyond dictatorship.

item.title: Ukraine’s fate in 2026 will define the international order
item.description: A flimsy peace would legitimize conquest. A durable one could still salvage deterrence.

item.title: How to make this time different in Iran
item.description: Weakening the regime is the right move morally and strategically.

item.title: This election is a charade — and America should say so
item.description: With Myanmar’s three-round election underway, the ruling junta craves undeserved legitimacy.

item.title: Behold, a Democrat who doesn’t preach from the Church of Progressivism
item.description: Rep. Jake Auchincloss has an exemplary way of talking about topics that resonate with centrist voters.

item.title: America’s fragile future elite will meet the real world eventually
item.description: A shocking number of students at top universities claim dubious disabilities — and get advantages.
